meanings.definition: Not derived from something else; original
meanings.sent1: The underived painting was created by the artist without any outside inspiration.
meanings.sent2: Her underived talent for music was evident from a young age.
meanings.sent3: The underived idea to have a picnic in the rain turned out to be quite a memorable experience.
meanings.sent4: His underived creativity shone through in every piece of artwork he produced.
meanings.sent5: The underived beauty of the untouched landscape left everyone in awe.

meanings.definition: Not obtained or acquired from another source
meanings.sent1: The underived information in the report was based solely on the researcher's findings.
meanings.sent2: The underived joy she felt upon receiving the award was priceless.
meanings.sent3: His underived excuse for being late involved a runaway circus elephant.
meanings.sent4: The underived courage she displayed in the face of danger was truly admirable.
meanings.sent5: The underived flavor of the homemade pie reminded him of his grandmother's baking.
